alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 22 at 5:46PM MST until August 22 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A DUST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM MST FOR PINAL COUNTY... At 545 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Olberg to near Florence Junction, moving northwest at 35 mph. HAZARD...Less than a mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 211 and 215. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 123 and 153. AZ Route 79 between mile markers 129 and 150. Locations impacted include... Florence, Coolidge, La Palma, Blackwater, Magma, San Tan Valley, Coolidge Airport, Florence Junction, Queen Valley, San Tan Mountain Park, Randolph, Valley Farms, and Sacaton. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
